meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

SCHiM, the game that has everyone hopping with excitement! I mean, who wouldn't be thrilled by a game that lets you play as a cute little shadow frog? It's like they knew exactly how to win me over - by being adorable!

But enough about my obvious biases (I mean, have you seen those eyes?!). Let's get down to business and see what the critics are saying.

Try Hard Guides thinks SCHiM is "a relaxing and artistic little game" with a "clever take on platform puzzles." I mean, that sounds like a great way to spend an afternoon - all cozy and artsy in your Steam library. But Hey, try-hard (heh), I'm not sure if they're trying too hard to be nice.

But Why Tho? agrees that SCHiM is worth jumping at, but then again, what's not worth jumping at when you have a game that's all about cute little shadow frogs?

Now, let's hear from IGN Deutschland - "The creative platformer Schim impresses using puzzles and jumping passages with innovative shadow mechanics...and a surprisingly touching story." Okay, okay, I get it - you guys like SCHiM too!

Gamer.nl says the game is "a brilliant idea in a special work of art" with a unique style, but then complains that it's "too repetitive in terms of gameplay and environments to last long." Hmm, sounds like someone needs to hop to a different conclusion (ba-dum-tss).

Power Unlimited agrees that SCHiM has a "fantastic concept" and a "beautiful...Dutch world," but then says the game doesn't surprise at all. Well, I guess that's what happens when you're trying too hard to be original.

Screen Rant thinks SCHiM is "a diamond in the rough" that needs some polish. And hey, who knows? Maybe with a little tweaking, it'll be shining like the top of the Chrysler building!

And finally, Edge Magazine gives SCHiM a lukewarm reception - it's just "a little thin" on its own. Okay, okay, I get it - you guys are trying to be all cool and indie-rock.

In conclusion, SCHiM is a game that's got everyone hopping with excitement! Even if some critics are being a bit too...schmoozy (oh man, I did it again). It's a fun, artistic little game that's sure to delight. And hey, who can resist those big ol' eyes?
